FRS_Method: GPS CARRIER PHASE STATIC RELATIVE POSITION

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
CERTIFICATION STATEMENT

Within the past five years, the process has had no accidential release that caused offsite impacts provided in the risk management program rule (40 CFR 68.10 (b) (10).  No additional measures are necessary to prevent offsite impacts from accidential releases.  In the event of release of the regulated substance, entry within the distance to the specified endpoints may pose a danger to emergency personnel.  Therefore, such personnel should not enter this are except as arranged with the emergency contacts indicated in the RMP.  The undersigned certifies that, to the best of my knowledge, information, and belief formed after reasonable inquiry, the information is true, accurate and complete.

___________________________________                                  _______________________________
SIGNATURE                                                                                     PRINT NAME


___________________________________                                  _______________________________
TITLE                                                                                                DATE


EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

A DESCRIPTION OF THE FACILITY.  Cenex of Rolla, Rolla, North Dakota is organized and operated on a cooperative basis for the purpose of supplying petroleum products, chemicals, fertilizers and farm supplies to its partons and mmbers.  It was incorporated on January 22, 1947

THE ACCIDENTIAL RELEASE AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES.  This facility complies with OSHA Regulations at 29 CFR 1910.38, and State EPCRA Rules and Laws.  It is our policy to comply with all applicable federal, state, and local laws.  In an emergency, it our policy to contact the Rolla Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency.

THE WORST-CASE RELEASE SCENARIO.  Our worst-case scenario involves a gas release due to a pull-away hose failure or a piping breakage.  According to EPA'S look-up tables, the distance to endpoint is 4.4 miles.  Ac

cording recent Census data, we estimate 1400 people would be effected, including the school, hospital, residential and recreation areas.

THE ALETRNATIVE CASE SCENARIO.  Our alternative release scenario involves a transfer hose failure.  The distance to end-point 0.10 miles.  We estimate that 50 people would be effected given the commercial area.  

GENERAL ACCIDENTIAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS.  This facility complies with the EPA'S accident release prevention rule and all applicable state and local regulations.  The NH3 facility has been designed, installed, and maintained accordingly.  

FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY.  We have never had an accident involving a release of NH3  that caused deaths, injuries, property or environmental damage.

THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM.  In the event of an emergency involving our NH3 facility, it is our policy to notify the Rolla Fire Department.  The Rolla Fire Department has inspected the facility and we have discussed this policy with the fire department.

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY.  None.
